title: Regression: spurious "error: expected `,`" in serde::Serialize on macro_rules-variable path enum discriminant

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
Somewhat minimized test case: (still involves serde_derive and syn)

```toml
[dependencies]
serde = {version = "1", features = ["derive"]}
syn = { version = "1", features = ["full"] }
```
```rust
mod gl {
    pub const DEPTH_COMPONENT: isize = 0;
}

macro_rules! gl_enums {
    ($mod:ident) => {
        #[derive(serde::Serialize)]
        pub enum TexFormat {
            DepthComponent = $mod::DEPTH_COMPONENT
        }
    }
}

gl_enums!(gl);
```

Compiles in `nightly-2020-05-24`, errors in `nightly-2020-05-25`:

```rust
$ cargo +nightly-2020-05-25 rustc -- -Z macro-backtrace
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.17
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.2.0
   Compiling syn v1.0.25
   Compiling serde v1.0.110
   Compiling quote v1.0.6
   Compiling serde_derive v1.0.110
   Compiling aa v0.1.0 (/tmp/aa)
error: expected `,`
  --> src/lib.rs:9:34
   |
5  | / macro_rules! gl_enums {
6  | |     ($mod:ident) => {
7  | |         #[derive(serde::Serialize)]
8  | |         pub enum TexFormat {
9  | |             DepthComponent = $mod::DEPTH_COMPONENT
   | |                                  ^^
10 | |         }
11 | |     }
12 | | }
   | |_- in this expansion of `gl_enums!`
13 | 
14 |   gl_enums!(gl);
   |   -------------- in this macro invocation

error: aborting due to previous error
```

Any of these changes makes compilation succeed:

* Removing use of `serde::Serialize`
* *Disabling* the `syn/full` feature
* Replacing `$mod` with a non-variable module name
* Replacing the path expression with a `{ use $mod::DEPTH_COMPONENT; DEPTH_COMPONENT }` block

Regression range: 8970e8bcf...46e85b432. Merges:

* Auto merge of #72539 - RalfJung:rollup-8yfidi8, r=RalfJung
* Rollup merge of #72535 - saschanaz:patch-1, r=jonas-schievink
* Rollup merge of #72532 - ratijas:dyn-trait-object-doc, r=jonas-schievink
* Rollup merge of #72530 - GuillaumeGomez:cleanup-e0602, r=Dylan-DPC
* Rollup merge of #72527 - RalfJung:miri-clippy-test-args, r=Mark-Simulacrum
* Rollup merge of #72402 - marmeladema:resolver-outputs-def-id, r=ecstatic-morse
* Auto merge of #72531 - RalfJung:miri-upd, r=RalfJung
* Auto merge of #72529 - RalfJung:rollup-ydthv90, r=RalfJung
* Rollup merge of #72528 - emosenkis:patch-1, r=dtolnay
* Rollup merge of #72393 - Aaron1011:feature/rewrite-collect-tokens, r=petrochenkov
* Rollup merge of #72284 - Aaron1011:feature/inline-macro-did, r=petrochenkov
* Auto merge of #72524 - RalfJung:rollup-s9f1pcc, r=RalfJung
* Rollup merge of #72517 - lcnr:refactor-winnowing, r=jonas-schievink
* Rollup merge of #72388 - Aaron1011:fix/deep-tokenstream-equality, r=petrochenkov
* Auto merge of #72362 - matthewjasper:remove-rescope, r=nikomatsakis
* Auto merge of #72516 - Dylan-DPC:rollup-cc4w96z, r=Dylan-DPC
* Rollup merge of #72502 - RalfJung:generator-discr-ty, r=jonas-schievink
* Rollup merge of #72489 - nbdd0121:issue-72487, r=Amanieu
* Rollup merge of #72400 - Aaron1011:fix/asm-incr-ice, r=Amanieu
* Rollup merge of #72092 - workingjubilee:patch-2, r=GuillaumeGomez
* Rollup merge of #71618 - ecstatic-morse:issue-71394, r=nikomatsakis
* Auto merge of #72474 - mati865:ci-fix, r=pietroalbini

Excluding those that seem unrelated to me leaves:

* https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/72402
